nasty.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant
nasty.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the nasty things that were being written about her
There’s a nasty streak in her character.
Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
When Harry refused, Don turned nasty and went for him with both fists.
Don’t be so nasty to your mum  (=do not treat her unkindly).
nasty.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: someone who is nasty behaves in an unkind and unpleasant way
nasty.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I went to school with him – he was nasty then and he’s nasty now.
nasty.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a nasty experience, feeling, or situation is unpleasant
nasty.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Life has a nasty habit of repeating itself.

When you feel you’ve been cheated, it always leaves a nasty taste in the mouth (=makes you feel upset or angry afterwards).
